item.description:
A 2-day hike on the Appalachian Trail starting north of Cheshire, MA and heading northbound over Mt. Greylock to North Adams, MA for a total of about 12.3 miles. This is the next segment of the AT from May '07. We'll spend the night at a Lean-to on the trail (there's a chance it could be full so plan accordingly). This hike is for experienced hikers who have done 10 mile hikes and steep trail before as well as lightly equiped backpacking.

We'll meet at 2pm at Pattison Rd. parking area south of N. Adams MA. (see below). Promptly at 2:15pm we will shuttle to Outlook Ave. in Cheshire MA to start the hike. The first day we'll cover 3.6 miles. We'll hike up the flank of Saddle Ball Mtn. for an altitude gain of 1,800ft. and sleep at the Mark Neopel Lean-to. We should be getting to the Lean-to before 5:30pm to set up for the night, eat dinner, and enjoy the evening. The Lean-to sleeps up to 10.

On the second day, we'll continue starting 8am at the latest on to the peak of Mt. Greylock (the tallest mountain in MA) with an altitude gain of 740ft., for an elevation of 3,491ft. We'll then hike down hitting Mt. Fitch and Mt. Williams with a total elevation loss of 2,590ft. Overall we'll cover 8.7 miles this day and end at the parking area for the AT on Pattison Rd. (see below). We should end hiking by about 6pm. After the hike, we'll hit a place to eat in N. Adams.

Please note that terrain, conditions, and individual party members may affect the overall timing of the hike and may necessitate backup plans if any member of the party runs into significant issues or if there are weather related issues that spring up. I have been conservitive with the estimated times and as long as all parties are reasonable fit, experienced, and equiped we should come in earlier than I estimated.

== ADVISED MUST-BRING GEAR/SUPPLIES ==
* Full pack
* Waterproofed hiking boots -Must be comfortable, & broken in
* Wool socks
* Layers of clothing -Cold mornings/nights & possibly hot afternoons, avoid cotton as it stays wet. Plus second day's clothing.
* Hat
* Rain parka/jacket
* Sleeping bag -Pref 3 season
* Headlamp -LED version best
* Waterproof matches
* Bear bag & 15' min light weight rope
* 2 quarts water
* 4 meals for on the trail -DAY-1: lunch, supper; DAY-2: breakfast, lunch (all trash to be packed out!). High energy meals should be planned. Only supper may be cooked but if getting up early (5 AM) then breakfast can be cooked too.
* Trail appropriate high energy snacks -e.g. at least G.O.R.P (Good Old Raisins and Peanuts), beef jerky, granola bars, etc.
* Bug spay
* Sunscreen
* Emergency whistle
* Pocket knife
== OPTIONAL GEAR ==
* Camera & extra batteries
* Mess kit -If needed
* Camping utensils
* Backpacking first aid kit (for blisters & such)
* Backpacking tent
* Backpacking stove and fuel
* Compass
* AT trail map -Massachusetts & Connecticut: Massachusetts Section 1, 2, & 3 (Map One) (VT line to Dalton, MA)

The leader on this event is Kevin S (http://hiking.meetup.... ) so all questions should be directed to him.

Approximate location/directions to the meetup location & AT ending point, parking area on Pattison Rd. south of N. Adams MA via MapQuest:
http://www.mapquest.c...

Approximate location/directions to the AT hike trailhead, Outlook Ave. north of Cheshire MA via MapQuest (Hard to find):
http://www.mapquest.c...

=== Legal Stuff ===
By clicking on "Yes" or "Maybe" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.

item.name: Hike on the AT over Mt. Greylock in Western MA
